trans-unit.source: Represents a collection of <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.CustomLabel"></xref> objects.

The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.CustomLabelsCollection> class represents a collection of <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.CustomLabel> objects, which in turn represent the custom labels that an <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Axis> object can use.
This class is exposed as the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Axis.CustomLabels%2A> collection property of an <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Axis> object.

You can automatically populate the entire label row of an axis with custom <xref:System.DateTime> labels using any <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.CustomLabelsCollection.Add%2A> method definition that includes a `DateTimeIntervalType` argument.
The <xref:System.Collections.ObjectModel.Collection%601.Count%2A> property indicates the total number of items in the collection and is commonly used to find the upper bound of the collection.
Adds multiple <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.CustomLabel"></xref> objects of type <xref href="System.DateTime"></xref> to the collection.
Populates the entire first row of an axis with labels.

The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.CustomLabelsCollection.Add%2A> method creates and initializes <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.CustomLabel> objects for the entire first label row of an axis with <xref:System.DateTime> labels of the specified type.
The `labelsStep` parameter determines how often the custom labels will be drawn.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.ChartArea.RecalculateAxesScale%2A> method must be called prior to calling this particular method definition.
A `Double` value that determines how often the custom labels will be drawn.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.DateTimeIntervalType"></xref> enumeration value that determines the interval type.
Adds a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.CustomLabel"></xref> object to the collection, using the given axis range and text.
Adds one custom label to the first label row of the relevant axis.
No label mark is used.
If a custom label is used anywhere in the first label row, no labels are automatically generated for that first row.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.ChartArea.RecalculateAxesScale%2A> method must be called prior to calling this particular method definition.
The minimum value of the axis range to which the label is applied.
The maximum value of the axis range to which the label is applied.
The label text.
The newly added <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.CustomLabel"></xref> object.
Adds multiple <xref href="System.DateTime"></xref><xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.CustomLabelsCollection"></xref> objects to the collection.
Populates the entire first row of an axis with labels with the specified format.

This method creates and initializes <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.CustomLabel> objects for an axis' entire first label row with <xref:System.DateTime> labels of the specified type.
The step determines how often the custom labels will be drawn, and optional label formatting can be specified as well.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.ChartArea.RecalculateAxesScale%2A> method must be called prior to calling this particular method definition.
A `Double` value that determines how often custom labels will be drawn.
A enumeration value that determines the unit of measure for the labelsStep parameter.
A value that determines the format of the custom label.
Adds a custom label to the collection, using the given axis range, text, row index and marking style.
The minimum value of the axis range the label is applied to.
The maximum value of the axis range the label is applied to.
The label text.
The label row index.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.LabelMarkstyle"></xref> enumeration value that specifies mark style for the label.
The newly added <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.CustomLabel"></xref> object.
Adds multiple custom labels to the collection.
The labels will be <xref href="System.DateTime"></xref> labels with the specified interval type, text format, row index and marking style.
A `Double` value that determines how often custom labels will be drawn.
A enumeration value that determines the unit of measure for the labelsStep parameter.
The label text format.
The label row index.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.LabelMarkstyle"></xref> enumeration value that specifies mark style for the label.
Adds a custom label to the collection, using the given axis range, text, row index, marking style and grid tick type.
The minimum value of the axis range the label is applied to.
The maximum value of the axis range the label is applied to.
The label text.
The label row index.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.LabelMarkstyle"></xref> enumeration value that specifies mark style for the label.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.GridTickTypes"></xref> enumeration value that specifies the grid tick for the label.
The newly added <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.CustomLabel"></xref> object.
Adds multiple custom labels to the collection.
The labels will be labels with the specified interval type, and will be generated for the axis range that is determined by the min and max arguments.
A `Double` value that determines how often custom labels will be drawn.
A enumeration value that determines the unit of measure for the labelsStep parameter.
The minimum value for the axis range.
The maximum value for the axis range.
The label text format.
The label row index.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.LabelMarkstyle"></xref> enumeration value that specifies mark style for the label.
